page.title: 17Oxford Street: 05280181
page.content: In the southern part of this block Oxford Street goes W from Oxford Circus to Bond Street and Marble Arch and includes some of London's largest stores: Selfridges, John Lewis, Marks and Spencer. Portland Place stretches from Park Crescent just S of Regents Park to the BBC's Broadcasting House, the central headquarters of the BBC is a listed building of superb 1930's art deco style. 'BH' is a London landmark along with All Souls Church nearby. The Langham, once a hotel known for its famous visitors, Lily Langtry and the Prince of Wales who became Edward VII, has long been a BBC building and is up for sale as the Corporation prepares to move to a new site at White City. The Central London Polytechnic, founded by Quentin Hogg, was the first polytechnic in the UK.
